text:
Chromium: CVE-2023-5475 Inappropriate implementation in DevTools 
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) for more information. 
Chromium: CVE-2023-5475 Inappropriate implementation in DevTools 
On this page 
 
CVE-2023-5475 
Security Vulnerability 
Released: Oct 13, 2023  
Assigning CNA: 
Chrome 
CVE-2023-5475  
 
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see  
Google Chrome Releases 
 for more information. 
Why is this Chrome CVE included in the Security Update Guide? 
The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based).  It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable.  Please see  
Security Update Guide Supports CVEs Assigned by Industry Partners 
 for more information. 
How can I see the version of the browser? 
In your Microsoft Edge browser, click on the 3 dots (...) on the very right-hand side of the window

metadata.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-5475 Inappropriate implementation in DevTools
metadata.description: This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) for more information.
metadata.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-5475, which was assigned by Chrome. This vulnerability is related to an inappropriate implementation in DevTools. The underlying cause is a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has addressed this vulnerability by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. System administrators are advised to ensure that their Microsoft Edge installations are updated to the latest version. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page. The security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 118.0.2088.46 resolves this vulnerability. Microsoft acknowledges the efforts of those in the security community who help protect customers through coordinated vulnerability disclosure.
metadata.nvd_description: inappropriate implementation in devtools in google chrome prior to 118.0.5993.70 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension to bypass discretionary access control via a crafted chrome extension. (chromium security severity: medium)
